title: Irakli Dzaria
text:
Irakli Dzaria (born 1 December 1988) is a <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgian</a> professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a>, who plays as a <a href="Midfielder%23Holding%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a>.
Club career.
Kukësi.
On 9 January 2018, Dzaria moved for the first time aboard and joined with Albanian club <a href="FK%20Kuk%C3%ABsi">Kukësi</a> by penning a contract until the end of the season with an option to renew for the next one worth $4,000 per month. He made his debut for the club on 31 January in the first leg of <a href="Albanian%20Cup">cup</a>'s <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Albanian%20Cup%23Quarter-finals">quarter-finals</a> against <a href="KF%20Tirana">Tirana</a>.
His first <a href="Albanian%20Superliga">Albanian Superliga</a> appearance came four days later in the 1–1 draw versus <a href="Flamurtari%20Vlor%C3%AB">Flamurtari Vlorë</a>. Dzaria scored his maiden goal for the team on 24 February in form of a winner in the match against <a href="KF%20La%C3%A7i">Laçi</a>.
Later on 13 May, he scored a first-half brace in the eventual 2–2 draw versus <a href="Luft%C3%ABtari%20Gjirokast%C3%ABr">Luftëtari Gjirokastër</a> which lifted his tally up to 4 goals. He ended the second part of 2017–18 season by making 16 league appearances, all of them as starter, collecting 1320 minutes as Kukësi finished runner-up in the championship.
In June 2018, Kukësi gained the right to play <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> football following the Skënderbeu Korçë's 10-year ban; the next month, Dzaria was included in manager <a href="Peter%20Pacult">Peter Pacult</a> squad for the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20UEFA%20Champions%20League%20qualifying%20phase%20and%20play-off%20round%23First%20qualifying%20round">first qualifying round</a> tie versus <a href="Malta">Malta</a>'s <a href="Valletta%20F.C.">Valletta</a>. In the second leg, with Kukësi trailing 0–1, Dzaria made himself a protagonist by netting in the 84th minute with a right-footed shot inside the box which gave the team a 1–1 draw at <a href="National%20Stadium%2C%20Ta%27%20Qali">National Stadium, Ta' Qali</a>. With the first match ending in a goalless draw, Kukësi progressed to the next round on away goal rule. It was his first Champions League goal, and he described it as the most important goal of his career.
International career.
Dzaria earned his first cap with the <a href="Georgia%20national%20football%20team">Georgian national team</a> against <a href="Albania%20national%20football%20team">Albania</a> in <a href="Viseu">Viseu</a> on 29 February 2012.
